extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese IV

winePairing.pairingText: Macaroni and Cheese works really well with Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. You could try PRONTO Lambrusco Secco. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: PRONTO Lambrusco Secco
productMatches.description: Crimson purple color. Aromas are rich with purple iris, clove and licorice. Medium-bodied, dry (secco), excellent concentration, rich finish, abundant fruit, dry. This wine offers complexity and richness on the palate.

recipes.instructions: In a large pot with boiling salted water cook macaroni pasta until al dente. Drain.                            In a large skillet cook ground beef until no pink remains. Drain excess grease.                            In a large bowl add the tomato juice, diced tomatoes, cooked ground beef, cooked and drained pasta, one package of the grated cheese, and mix well. Pour into a 2 quart casserole baking dish. Spread remaining package of grated cheese over the top.                            In a 425 degree F (220 degree F) oven bake until the cheese on top is melted, then broil until the cheese is golden brown.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: In a large pot with boiling salted water cook macaroni pasta until al dente.
In a large skillet cook ground beef until no pink remains.
In a large bowl add the tomato juice, diced tomatoes, cooked ground beef, cooked and drained pasta, one package of the grated cheese, and mix well.
Pour into a 2 quart casserole baking dish.
Spread remaining package of grated cheese over the top.
In a 425 degree F (220 degree F) oven bake until the cheese on top is melted, then broil until the cheese is golden brown.
